title: The 2 bigish trees
description: Sycamore (Acer pseudoplatanus) on the left and Ash (Fraxinus excelsior) on the right (trunk covered in ivy), the 2 most ordinary tree species in my area. I love them both, Doing a bit of thinking this afternoon, These are the 2 biggest trees on the South side of Ranger's field. Ranger died at the start of December which was a sad time for our family and still very much in our thoughts but, (as we have to do) moving on and thinking ahead I now have 1 acre of paddock to manage and Spring is on the way. I want to plant some fast growing trees and hedging and will do that but I really want manage most of the area as a diverse native perennial meadow for wild pollinators and other wildlife plus some annual sowing areas with blocks of borage, phacelia, dwarf sunflower and a few other annuals specifically for my honey bees. Going to do a bit more thinking/reading between now and the Spring. I feel I do have the tools (my 2 wheel tractor has a good tiller and very powerful flail mower) and I have the time to do it properly at this scale. ....warning this may generate a lot of photographs Belle and Sebastian - Family Tree www.youtube.com/watch?v=YbpXOOnRU6g
label: Original
